column1: # SOURCE: Fraunhofer ISE agri-PV research; University of Arizona agri-PV microclimate studies
# DESCRIPTION: Microclimate adjustments for agri-PV systems quantifying how panel density affects temperature
# LOGIC: Higher panel density provides more shading
column2: reducing temperature and irradiance reaching crops
column4: and lowering evapotranspiration through combined effects of cooler temps and less solar radiation. ET multiplier derived from combined temp and irradiance effects.

column1: # DEPENDENCIES: None - standalone reference table used by irrigation demand and crop yield calculations
# ASSUMPTIONS: Values represent midpoint of typical ranges from literature. Actual microclimate effects vary with panel height (assumed 3.0m)
column3: and local conditions. Wind reduction assumes typical agricultural setting without significant surrounding obstructions.
